editorialNotes.standard: If you can imagine it, you can create it—anything from monolithic towers to cavernous rollercoasters. That’s the idea that sparked a world-building phenomenon in Mojang’s amazing Minecraft. Since the game's release on the App Store, a steady stream of meaningful updates has kept this cube-filled universe fun, fresh and jam-packed with exciting features.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The infection has begun and it’s up to you to strategically spread and evolve a deadly plague to bring about the end of the human race. Saving the world and being a hero is honourable, but decimating the world with a deadly infection is a whole lot of fun — even though it shouldn’t be.

name: Ticket to Ride® The Board Game

ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Moving’s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

ios.subtitle: Roll the Dice, Pass Go & Win

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you get out alive?

editorialNotes.standard: The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defence series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: After a long day at work, it’s bath time! But Swampy’s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: It’s one thing to say you’d never take a bribe: It’s quite another when your options are taking one or missing rent or going hungry. That’s but a taste of the moral quandaries in Papers, Please, which puts you in the shoes of a border checkpoint agent in a fictional 1980s nation. Learning to master passport processing skills, avoiding fines, and making the most of your paycheck is uniquely satisfying and provocative in a way few games manage to achieve. This celebrated indie gem teaches us as much about empathy as it does time management.

name: A Little to the Left: Drawers

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Unravel family secrets on a remote island cursed by plagues in this dark puzzle adventure.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Mesmerising from start to finish, Monument Valley offers a world of uncanny beauty and constant wonder. To help a princess proceed on her mysterious quest, you’ll face ingenious puzzles that involve lifting and spinning the environment in seemingly impossible ways. It’s a mind-bending journey filled with the joy of discovery, making Ustwo’s adventure a must-play for gamers of every experience level.
editorialNotes.short: Traverse mind-bending levels that are structurally impossible

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: A Dance of Fire and Ice

editorialNotes.tagline: Don't let the zombies stop you

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Harvest crops of olives, grapes, and sorghum for the first time in this long-running sim series that lets you really dig into the details of virtual farming.
Cool reaction emoji! Strategy-smashing Nope cards! The fur truly flies in this slick adaptation of the zany card game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The enchantingly eccentric Rusty Lake series heads underground! Solve strange puzzles in train stations representing different eras of a woman’s life.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Ancient Egyptians loved cats, Metallica hasn’t played the Super Bowl, and the Ganges is India’s largest river—all our useless knowledge is now coming in handy thanks to Trivia Crack. This bite-sized trivia game is totally irresistible, whether we’re dominating our Facebook friends in classic mode, trouncing strangers in the 12-question challenge mode, or just sneaking in a game on our Apple Watch. With its cute characters, heaps of unlockable achievements, and a massive variety of questions, we simply can’t get enough.
Form smart alliances to keep the spice flowing in this superb digital re-imagining of the popular board game.

editorialNotes.tagline: Join the battle for Bikini Bottom
Plan a new metro in Chongqing
editorialNotes.standard: Build the perfect commute on your next commute with the hypnotic Mini Metro. Strategy buffs and casual gamers alike will enjoy expanding a busy transit system by linking stations, directing trains and upgrading lines. There’s a thrilling satisfaction in seeing underground lines come together—and since no two games play alike, we’re always trying out new designs.
editorialNotes.short: Construct the perfect commute in this underground masterpiece.

editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

editorialNotes.tagline: Our favourite love guru is back!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: A Little to the Left: Stars

ios.subtitle: Build your own city as mayor!
A story of beauty and illusion

editorialNotes.standard: We couldn’t wait to go back to the land of twisty towers and uncanny beauty—and this sequel didn’t let us down. With its striking colours and level design, it’s even more stunning than the first game. New elements like light beams and controlling two characters make the puzzles even trickier. The bond between that mother and child is what we’ll remember most, though—their relationship moved us in a way few games do.
editorialNotes.short: An unforgettable adventure full of challenging puzzles and gorgeous visuals.

editorialNotes.standard: With no time limit, you’re free to relax and fully explore every level in this hidden object game and discover all the secrets, like tapping on a snake to pop a chicken out of its mouth.
editorialNotes.short: Search for hidden people and objects in detailed, hand-drawn landscapes.
Game 14. Explore an ancient, mysterious world.
editorialNotes.tagline: Game 14. Explore an ancient, mysterious world.

editorialNotes.standard: You might get stuck the first time you play Gorogoa. But once the gears of your brain settle into the right configurations, you’ll see how smart this mix of art and perspective really is. Layers pile upon layers, doors transport you between realities, strange creatures and wild environments blend together into a fascinating interactive collage you’ll want to peel apart to discover what lies underneath.

Switch on the laser pointer! Scoop the litter! Rub the belly of the all-seeing Pig-a-Corn! This mobile version of the insanely irreverent card game brings the fatal felines to our devices, along with a few purr-fect new twists. The hysterical illustrations by Matthew Inman (creator of The Oatmeal) spring to life with animation and sound—and a meter that tracks the chance of drawing an exploding kitten makes the game even more hilariously tense. Played face-to-face with friends or online against strangers, it’s surprisingly strategic and cat-astrophically fun.
Prehistoric times were pretty rough–and this fine digital adaptation of the popular survival board game doesn’t hold back.

Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The game’s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TV—we feel like we’re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

ios.subtitle: The new racing game to beat!

editorialNotes.short: Tearing across the countryside is a blast with fine-tuned controls

editorialNotes.standard: We’ve played plenty of grid-based puzzlers, but there’s just something about Link Twin that feels right. It might be the gorgeous, minimal art direction. Or maybe it's the wonderfully subtle animation or the excellent use of Force Touch. Whatever it is, we can’t stop swiping our way through the bite-sized challenges. Helping a duo reach different destinations is tough—but totally rewarding.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
